data.name: AnimationCalcMode
desc: Specifies the interpolation mode for the animation.

items.name: DISCRETE
lines: This specifies that the animation function will jump from one value to the next without any interpolation.

items.name: LINEAR
lines: Simple linear interpolation between values is used to calculate the animation function.

items.name: PACED
lines: Defines interpolation to produce an even pace of change across the animation.
This is only supported for values that define a linear numeric range, and for which some notion of \"distance\" between points can be calculated (e.g. position, width, height, etc.).

items.name: SPLINE
lines: Interpolates from one value in the values list to the next according to a time function defined by a cubic Bezier spline.
The points of the spline are defined in the XAnimate.KeyTimes attribute, and the control points for each interval are defined in the XAnimate.TimeFilter attribute.
